name: Abbey Brewing Company, LLC
description:
Abbey Beverage Company, located in Abiquiu, New Mexico, is the producer of Monks' Ales starting with Monks' Ale released in 2005.

The brewery is located on the grounds of the Benedictine Monastery of Christ in the Desert.  The monks do not allow visits to the brewery.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.streetAddress: Monastery of Christ in the Desert

name: Archibald Microbrasserie
description: The two microbreweries restaurant Archibald have become essential in Quebec! They are more than ever THE appointment of people connected to a drunken evening with friends or a delicious dinner head to head. On the beautiful terrace of one of the two microbreweries, there is no reason not to take the opportunity to come and offer an excellent meal while sipping a beer brewed on site. In addition, Microbrewery Archibald welcomes evening groups and singers who give the final touches to a friendly atmosphere among the most in Quebec!

name: Beer Valley Brewing Company
description: Beer Valley Brewing Company is an award winning microbrewery located in Eastern Oregon. Founded in 2005 by brewer Pete Ricks, the brewery started production in Ontario, Oregon in the summer of 2007. Specializing in the production of strong ales, the brewery currently produces 6 brands year round, plus occasional seasonals. Beer Valley Brewing beers are available in the states of Oregon, Washington, Idaho, California, Nevada, and Arizona.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Thursdays:  2 - 6 PM
Fridays:  2 - 6 PM
Saturdays:  11 AM - 3 PM

name: Big E Ales
description: Our unique, cozy and family-friendly brewpub is tucked away in a small industrial park in Lynnwood, WA. We have been at this location producing our handcrafted ales since 2005. We take pride in serving our patrons more than just a quick beer or a bite to eat; we want to build friendships that go beyond the bar. Beer to us is something that bonds and brings people together from all walks of life. We specialize in transforming your events and parties either at our brewery or your home into an impressive beer experience. Our dispensing systems are not only innovative and efficient, they will enhance your party and will impress your guests…they will be talking about the amazing beer and the cool “party pig” long after your party. Over the past 5 years we have grown from a small production brewery with a tasting room into a neighborhood hangout. Come in and enjoy one of our handcrafted beverages in our cedar lined pub or out in our beer garden, oh and don’t forget to order our Big “E” Signature Reuben. Next time you are faced with a “Beer Emergency” either personal or with your friends come down to the Big “E” and we will help bail you out.

name: Black Diamond Brewing Company
description: Unwind after a day on the slopes or, more likely, a day in the office, with a hand-crafted Black Diamond brew at our Concord brewing facility. Your taste buds will immediately appreciate the finest of ingredients that go into making our exceptionally refreshing and flavorful beers, and you will feel right at home in our welcoming Tap Room. Sample some of our famous ales and enjoy a tour of our brewery - you will quickly realize why our seasoned Brewmaster is a multiple award-winning brewer. You have worked hard. Give yourself a break. Let Black Diamond Brewing help you and your friends dial down from a day of 'shredding' on the slopes or at the office.

name: Boone Brewing Co, LLC
description: Since 2005, local High Country business professionals, Todd Rice and Jeff Walker, have been collaborating on a beer recipe to fit their love of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Principals of Boone Brewing Company, LLC, and the brand owners of Blowing Rock Ale and seasonal brews, Todd and Jeff take great pride in bringing their dream to reality. Both feel comfort and responsibility in calling the Blue Ridge Mountains home. The beauty of the mountains, the energy and enthusiasm of their mountaineer neighbors and their personal associations inspired them to pursue a brew that could capture the best of this area. They invite you to go to the mountains through a Blowing Rock Ale or seasonal brew!

name: Breaker Brewing Company
description: The idea of The Breaker Brewing Company resulted when long time friends, Chris Miller and Mark Lehman, decided it was time to take their interest and appreciation of fine craft beer to the next level. Their intrigue in the complexity of the brewing process coupled with their quest to make a quality product, led to their decision to start creating their own beer.

name: Bright Brewery
description:
At Bright Brewery we use fresh mountain water, quality ingredients and craft brewing techniques to brew our MountainCrafted™ beers.

With our brewery door open daily from 12 noon 'till evening, kick back with award-winning beers at Bright Brewery, on the Great Alpine Road in the heart of Bright.

Overlooking the river, parks and mountains, Bright Brewery's great for a beer and a bite. You can relax with a beer either outside looking over the riverside parkland, or at the bar while keeping an eye on the brewing activity. Or get comfy on one of the couches by the fire, and check your emails using our Free WiFi Hotspot internet service. Kids love the adjacent adventure playground.

Each dish on our menu is great with one of our beers. There's also Jasper Fairtrade Organic Coffee, Hot Chocolate, local wine, and drinks for the kids.

Have an adventure choosing your favourite beers from our regular range and our ever-changing Brewer's Choice beers. Whet your appetite.

Our Tour-and-Tasting experience is an opportunity to discover how we use craft brewing techniques to create award-winning beer. Tours run every Friday and Saturday at 3pm, and Monday at 12 noon. Book now.

For more opportunities to indulge your love of beer, check out our events.

Ask for Bright Brewery beer in local restaurants, pubs, bars and supermarkets.

name: Bristol Beer Factory
description:
BBF Beers like Bristol itself seamlessly blends the modern and historical. Tried and trusted styles of beer with modern interpretations, brewed in a hundred year old brewery building that harks back to an industrial age gone by, drunk in the modern surroundings of Bristol’s bars and pubs.

Today’s finest ingredients, malt from Wiltshire and hops from Herefordshire, in Award Winning beers made by people who care. We are constantly trying to pack as much flavour into our beers as possible; we don’t cut corners, and always seek to improve the beers we brew.

Enjoy Bristol Beer Factory beers in the pubs, bars & cafes from a cask, or at home from our new range of bottle-conditioned beers available throughout the southwest and online here.

name: Brugge Brasserie
description:
Located in Indianapolis’ Broad Ripple Neighborhood, Brugge Brasserie specializes in award-winning handcrafted ales and classic Belgian brasserie fair.

The landscape of Belgian beer includes a dizzying array of styles. Each of them offers the drinker something extremely special. Our selection of handcrafted beers looks to honor the Belgian tradition while keeping a firm grasp on our Indiana roots.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon – Sat: 11:00 am – 10:30 pm
Sun: Noon – 9:00 pm

name: Bruggsmiðan
description:
Bruggsmidjan ehf. was established in December 2005, so the company is very young but it has gone through a lot of changes and has been enlarged twice since it was opened. The idea of making a mini brewery came from two people in Árskogssandur, the couple Agnes Anna and Olafur Trostur, after Agnes saw a small news report on Icelandic television. The report was about growing popularity of small breweries in Denmark, and a week later they were in Denmark to see breweries. Early in 2006 they found investers and today there are 15 individuals who share 44% of the company, and Agnes and Olafur own 56%.

The idea for Agnes and Olafur was to make a new brand of beer to sell, and they only wanted to make a beer which had high quality and rich taste, so they chose to use a Czech tradition beacause beers from Czech Republic are known for their good quality. Agnes and Olafur had two options of making the beer, they could either find a beer that they liked and buy the recipe and make the beer in Iceland, or make the choice they did. They hired a brewmaster named David Masa, a brewmaster from Czech and he has studied brewing for 9 years but the standard education is 4 years. They made their own beer from their ideas of good beer. They decided to make high quality beer, and use only the best raw materials they could get. They get all the materials from Czech Republic exept of course the Icelandic fresh water wich they get from a mountain in Arskogssandur.

The outcome  is Kaldi. An Icelandic beer, brewed by a Czech recipe and has only the best materials. The beer has no added sugar or any preservatives, an Kaldi is not pasteurized. All this makes Kaldi as fresh and healthy as he can possibly be.

In the beginning Kaldi was producedin 170.000 lt. per year. But due to very good sale of the beer and lot of requests , they had to add fermentation tanks and after that, Kaldi was produced in 300.000 lt. per year.

 Bruggsmidjan now produces Kaldi, Kaldi dark, Kaldi lite and Gullfoss.

name: Butternuts Beer and Ale
description:
Established in 2005, Butternuts Beer and Ale is located on a 120-acre farm in the beautiful Butternut Valley. Brewing in a renovated dairy barn, we brew American-style farmhouse ales with German, English and Belgian influences. Water is taken from our own springs and lends to our signature flavor. Our beer is made with natural ingredients and no pretense. We've been known to throw in a few spices or fruits into our beer. Our most popular beer, Pork Slap Pale Ale is sweet and malty, brewed with fresh ginger root. Heinnieweisse is a German-style weissebier with tart citrus and banana notes. For all our hopheads, Snapperhead is an American IPA with light spicy and earthy hop flavors. And don't forget about Moo Thunder American Stout with its espresso, dark chocolate, smoky flavor.
We change up the beer on draft pretty regularly, so stop by often. You can sample all our year-round brews, plus any specialty styles we have on draft. Take a tour of our brewery and learn about the brewing process, ingredients and history. Our beer is available for sale in 6-packs or cases and don't forget to bring your growler.

name: Chama River Brewing Company
description: A multiple GABF medal winning brewpub considered one of Albuquerque's longest standing pioneers of great craft beer in New Mexico.

name: Dry Dock Brewing Company
description:
Dry Dock Brewing Company was founded in October 2005 when owners Michelle and Kevin DeLange leased an 800 sq ft space next to their homebrew shop, The Brew Hut, in Aurora, CO. The tiny brewery quickly got people’s attention the next spring when Dry Dock won Gold at the 2006 World Beer Cup for its HMS Victory ESB (now Amber Ale).

Expanding in 2009 and again in 2011, Dry Dock currently runs a 7 BBL brewhouse including a tasting room with 180 seats and 16 taps at its original location on Hampden Ave. in Aurora.

In January 2013, Dry Dock opened a production facility with a 40 BBL brewhouse and canning line in a second, 30,000 sq ft facility, to produce beers for distribution throughout Colorado. Dry Dock’s production has grown from 300 barrels in 2006 to 3,200 in 2012. With the new facility, they will produce about 11,000 BBL in 2013. They have also continued to win medals at both the World Beer Cup and the Great American Beer Festival, including Small Brewing Company of the Year in 2009.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon - Thu: 12:00 am - 9:00 pm
Fri - Sat: 12:00 am - 11:00 pm
Sun: 12:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Dugges Ale- & Porterbryggeri AB
description:
Dugges Ale- & Porterbryggeri (Dugge's Ale & Porter Brewery) is a microbrewery situated in Mölndal outside Gothenburg, Sweden. The brewery was started in 2005 by Mikael Dugge Engström and is focused on top-fermented beers, influenced by US micro breweries. The ales are brewed with lots of hops, such as Chinook, that gives them a strong and pleasant aroma. The brewery is very active in inventing new types of beer and usually has many test batches for sale.

The brewery has won several medals in competitions. For instance gold medal at the Stockholm Beer & Whiskey Festival.

In 2007 the brewery purchased a bottling machine in addition to previously sold barrels. The beer is sold at several bars and restaurants in Sweden as well as at Systembolaget.

name: Element Brewing Company‎
description: Element Brewing produces unique hand crafted beer that just has to be tasted. We fuse styles and flavors together and break the style barrier.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon - Tue: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm
Thu - Sat: 12:00 pm - 6:00 pm

name: Flounder Brewing Company
description: Flounder Brewing Co. is a home grown, soon-to-be nanobrewery located in Hillsborough, New Jersey. Originally started as a hobby by Jeremy "Flounder" Lees, he was quickly joined by his brothers Michael and Daniel. With your support, we are confident that Flounder Brewing Co. will become a New Jersey favorite!

name: Furthermore Beer
description:
Furthermore bought a building way back in 2005 with the hopes of shoe-stringing together an undersized, Frankenstein-style brewery. The reason for so lofty a goal was of course to cheaply serve the more important purpose of the business--getting beer to the beer drinker, putting bottles on the shelf. However, even “cheap” was expensive to us. Pinching pennies and moving cautiously wasn’t helping us reach our self imposed deadline of Summer of 2006. Then we met the good folks at Sand Creek Brewing Co (Black River Falls, WI) who agreed to bring us on as customers, allowing us to use their facility to get the beer brewed. We were thus able to skip the hard lessons of construction pitfalls and went straight to filling stainless steel tanks with beer. 

The scrape-together building and used equipment model was then blacked out from the “Phase 1” section of the business plan. Aran went on the road to be hands on at Sand Creek; Chris went on the road to sell beer. We have since acquired another property in Spring Green (known affectionately as the Shitty Barn), and we have often been heard threatening to build a brewery on this site, sometimes quite convincingly. But “if it ain’t broke, don’t fix it” seems to be the winning adage. So until we break it, we won’t likely fix our present model. 

So that is the back story--the mental seasoning for your next sip of Furthermore Beer. Fair warning to the newcomer: those who like our beers always seem to find at least one to stick in the “hate” column—ant that’s always one that someone else places in the “love” column with a glittery heart sticker next to it. So remember, if you have distaste for one of our beers, it could our failings, or it could be your poor upbringing and resulting prejudices--so hate with an open mind.

name: Gella's Diner & Lb. Brewing Company
description:
A native of the rural western Kansas community of Brownell, Gerald Wyman and his wife, Janet, raised two daughters and lived the typical rural farming and ranching lifestyle. But following his children’s graduation from high school, Gerald sold the cattle and leased the land. All for his love of beer.

It wasn’t a side effect of empty-nest syndrome or a midlife crisis. Janet, who endured her husband’s brewing experiments in her kitchen for years, finally banned Gerald’s brewing operations to the garage where he set up a larger operation and brewed the first of his award winning home brews. Realizing Gerald had a great talent, the couple decided to open a microbrewery in nearby Hays.

The Wymans planned to open their microbewery in a strip mall. That is until they met Chuck Comeau. Chuck is a rural entrepreneur whose innovative talents led to the creation of the Dessin Fournir Companies, six luxury goods firms whose clientele includes Hollywood’s elite, media moguls and royalty.

name: Great Oakley
description:
After 7 years at the Great Oakley location, husband and wife team Phil and Hazel Greenway now operate their five-barrel plant from a new rural location in the heart of the Northamptonshire countryside at Tiffield.

It is an exciting new challenge but one thing is for sure; the name hasn't changed and the beers will be as good as ever, no doubt continuing to win awards at major events across the country!

name: Hideout Brewing Company
description:
Originally opened in early 2005, the company was named for both the location and for the feel of pre-prohibition era local brewery. Taken over in early 2012 by new owners Scott Colson and Nick and Theresa Humphrey, the Hideout’s footprint has grown quite extensively. Now distributing to much of the southern half of the Lower Peninsula, they are adding new regions regularly. Coming soon will be bottled beer!

In the taproom, the selection recently increased to 25 taps directly behind the J shaped bar. The upper loft has darts, shuffle board and three big screen TVs. Behind the building you will find a Beer Garden including horseshoe pits and ample seating.

Menu beers available year round are Promiscuous Pilsner, Tommy Gun Red, Gangster IPA, and Smuggler’s Hazelnut Stout. Other offerings vary throughout the year including Wine, Seasonal and Specialty Beers, Hard Cider, and Mead.

name: Hogan's Cider
description:
Hogan’s ciders and perries are fermented from just fresh pressed English apples and pears, no sugars are added prior to fermentation and no apple or pear juice concentrate is used.

We hope you have a chance to enjoy our ciders and perry and we are very keen to hear your comments, favourable or otherwise.

name: Hollywood Beach Brewing Co
description: Hollywood Beach Brewing Company was founded by Chris Hanson and Jeff Brown, two long time high school buddies, in the summer of 2005.  Brewing began as a hobby on the kitchen stove and soon became a passion border lining a hobby gone mad.

name: Kannah Creek Brewing Company
description:
Our journey began in 2005 in Grand Junction, Colorado, when we opened a small brewpub Kannah Creek Brewing Company.  During the first seven years of brewing our focus was always on quality as we developed seven traditional beer styles and multiple seasonal and specialty beers.  With several awards to our name and a growing demand for our beer, we took a huge leap and expanded into a brand new 12,000 square foot 30 barrel production facility in the south downtown area of Grand Junction near the Colorado River.  This new restaurant that also houses our production facility is known as Edgewater Brewery.

Throughout our growth we have invested our time, energy, and resources reflecting our passion and devotion to maintain the highest standard quality.  We currently bottle three of our mainstays in additional to seasonal selections.  Plus limited release bomber bottles of a select variety.  We pride ourselves in making beer that is true to its style, pleasing to the palate and very drinkable.

name: Langham Brewery
description:
Langham is a traditional craft micro-brewery. We have a restored 10 barrel steam heated plant, updated with the latest control and measurement equipment to ensure consistent and flavoursome beers every brew.

What sets us apart?

First we only use the finest quality ingredients - water, floor malted barley and aroma hops, sourced as far as possible from local English suppliers.

And second, we cask conditions our beer. For every landlord this means a longer shelf life than beer from conditioning tanks. And for the real ale people it means better, fresher tasting beer.

Visitors are always welcome to the brewery shop for offsales - from two pints to a firkin for that special occasion, party or wedding. The brewery is open on Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday, but please ring in advance to avoid disapointment.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon - Tue: 9:00 am - 5:30 pm
Thu: 9:00 am - 5:30 pm
Sat:	10:00 am - 5:00 pm

name: Laughing Dog Brewing
description: At Laughing Dog Brewing, what began with a dream for brews with more hops has turned into an insatiable desire to craft beers of all flavors, with a focus on quality, purity, and fun. Today, Laughing Dog brews has brewed over 15 distinct beers, including seasonals like our Huckleberry Ale and Winter Ale, and our award-winning IPA's and Stouts. But despite our success and growth, our motto remains the same as the day we started, to create... "Fetchingly Good Beer"!

name: Leelanau Brewing
description:
We do not pitch any wild yeasts into our alchemy. Our magic is performed the old fashioned way.

Each and every beer is hand-made in small batches, using age old techniques of open fermentation, barrel aging and bottle conditioning.

name: Maui Brewing Co.
description: Maui Brewing Co., with a brewpub in Kahana and production brewery in Lahaina, has built a reputation for creating handcrafted beers brewed using the finest natural ingredients.  We have become one of the area's most popular dining locations and are the island's only microbrewery.  Our menu offers a broad selection of fine foods to satisfy any palate.

name: Micro-brasserie Le Trou du diable
description: The Devil's Hole is a place of culinary discovery. Here you will have the chance to enjoy unique beers that will satisfy your taste buds as well as your appetite will be filled by the merits of his dishes.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon - Tue: 3:00 pm - 11:00 pm
Wed - Thu: 3:00 pm - 1:00 am
Fri - Sat: 3:00 pm - 3:00 am
Sun: 3:00 pm - 11:00 pm

name: Moo Brew
description: The Moo Brew brewery was installed at MONA, then Moorilla Estate, in 2005. In June of that year the first keg was sold and went on tap at T42° on Hobart’s waterfront. In 2010 Moo Brew expanded and opened a second brewery site 10 minutes up the road in Bridgewater, Tasmania. Due to continued expansion all brewery operations are now carried out at this secondary site.

name: Mountain State Brewing Company
description:
As Natives of West Virginia, it has long been our dream to bring quality hand-crafted beer back to our state.

Originally from Elkins and Helvetia, we were raised on easy drinking beers and homemade wine. Curiosity eventually got the best of us, and we combined the two - our first batch of homebrew was conceived in the early 90's with home brewing equipment, books, and some ingredients handed down from our parent's home brewing days in the 70's.

Since then we've learned a lot about brewing professionally. We developed easy drinking and well rounded beers with our own state of the art brewing equipment. We sold our first beer in October 2005 and now we're distributing throughout the Canaan Valley, Davis, Thomas, Elkins, Morgantown and Fayetteville.

That's our story so far. Thank you for all the great support we've received pursuing our dream.

- Brian & Willie

name: Mt. Carmel Brewing Company
description:
Mt. Carmel Brewing Company is a local family owned and operated brewery. The brewery was founded in May of 2005 by Cincinnati natives Mike and Kathleen Dewey. 

Inspired with a passion for good beer, founders Mike and Kathleen Dewey work towards providing exceptional craft beers to the greater Cincinnati area. We look forward to serving our customers, as if each was our first and only. We look to grow at a comfortable pace not to jeopardize our focus on product quality, customer service, and a respectful business practice.

name: Negev Brewery
description:
Negev Brewery started in 2005 as one of the first home-breweries in Israel.
Already at this stage, the special beers have won recognition and appreciation throughout the country, earning numerous awards.

name: Otley Brewing Company
description: The Otley Brewing Company Limited, colloquially Otley Brewery, is a brewery located in Pontypridd, Wales. Established in 2005, it has won several awards, including the Champion Beer of Wales in 2006. The head brewer is Charlie Otley.

name: Pittsfield Brew Works
description: We have been crafting great beer, great food, and good times here in Pittsfield since 2005. Our main philosophy is you get what you give.Throughout the year we source ingredients for our menu and our beer locally. We pride ourselves on producing the freshest food and beer in the Berkshires. Our pub serves as a community hub for locals and varied organizations. Our laidback environment, dynamic menu, and great beers makes the Brew Works the best brewpub in the area.We are located in the heart of downtown Pittsfield at:

name: Power House Brewing Company
description: Doug Memering and Jon Myers formed Power House Brewing Co. in 2005. After discovering The Columbus Bar was available for purchase in 2006 they decided this was the perfect location for the pub side of the Brewpub they had been planning. After purchasing the assets of the business and with the help of the Custer Foundation Power House Brewing Co. restored the old Columbus Bar, updating the kitchen and restrooms and brightening the bar and family dining with lively colors and new lighting. They also added twenty draft lines and updated the equipment. We are proud to carry on this Columbus tradition.

locations.name: Columbus Bar
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Monday - Thursday 11 a.m. - 11 p.m.
Friday - Saturday 11 a.m. - 1 a.m.
Sunday 4 p.m. - 11

name: Purity Brewing Co
description: One of the fastest growing craft breweries in the UK, producing three award-winning beers.

name: Rebellion Brewing
description: John O’Brien never planned to own a brewery. In fact this was the last thing he imagined he would be doing with a background in engineering and a career as an engineering consultant and project manager in the construction industry. But after John was diagnosed with coeliac disease in 1998, and his doctor advised him that he could no longer drink beer, he set himself the mammoth task of creating his own gluten free craft beer that tasted just as good, if not better, than traditional barley based beer.

name: Shamrock Brewing Company
description:
At the Shamrock we take pride in brewing fresh craft brewed beer with influences from around the world.  Adhering to traditional German, English, Irish, Belgian, and American styles, we use the best ingredients available to produce the highest quality product.  As an American craft brewery, we occasionally brew outside the box, creating new and unique beers that push the envelope.

Our beer recipes are formulated and brewed in house, using premium domestic and imported malted barley and other grains such as wheat, oats, and rye.  Our base 2-row barley is the freshest around, malted right here in southern Colorado by Colorado Malting Company.  We use the choicest hops from the Pacific Northwest and yeast strains carefully chosen by our brewer.  We never use additives, preservatives, or pasteurization in our brewing process. We also never filter our beer. Enjoy

name: The Livery
description: Over one hundred years ago, the building known as the Palace Livery provided a vital service making it a unique gathering place for residents of and travelers to Southwest Michigan. This former horse stable has been brought back to life as The Livery. Located at 190 5th street, in the Arts District of downtown Benton Harbor, Michigan, the Livery features 12 taps of "Hand-Forged Microbrew", 2 Real Ale taps, an outdoor bier garden, free WIFI, and a Café serving great food. Music and other live entertainment are regularly featured in The Upper Livery entertainment venue. You must be age 21 or older to enter The Livery. People under age 21 must be accompanied by parent or legal guardian.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon - Thu: 4:00 pm - 12:00 am
Fri: 11:30 am - 1:00 am
Sat: 12:00 pm - 1:00 am
Sun: 12:00 pm - 12:00 am

name: The Root Cellar Cafe and Brewery
description:
We are the first and only brew pub in San Marcos, Texas.

Meet our brewer, Robert Brushaber. He has been homebrewing since the 90′s, and has graduated from the American Brewers Guild with a Craft Brewers Apprenticeship (CBA) in 2010. He apprenticed at the Real Ale Brewery in Blanco, and began brewing at the Root Cellar in 2012. The house beers brewed by Robert are Alison’s Ale, Cream Steam, Santa Fe Stout, and a Gluten Free IPA.

Alison’s Ale - A highly complex, clean and refreshing taste with a blend of six different malts and three different hops.

Cream Steam - Steam Beers are in a category all their own. Is it a lager? Is it an ale? Actually, it’s a lager brewed at ale temperatures. This higher temperature fermentation produces a beer with more “fruity” qualities than your average lager. The hops are 100% Northern Brewer, but Robert has lowered the hop bill to make this Steam Beer a bit more creamy and smooth.

Santa Fe Stout – This dry Stout, moderately bittered with Kent Golding hops, has flavor notes that remind me of a cup of dark coffee sipped from a warm mug on a cold Santa Fe morning.

Gluten Free Beer - Made with Sorghum, Honey, and Hops.

name: Thornbridge Brewery
description:
Thornbridge craft beers were first produced in the spring of 2005 in the 10 barrel brewery, in the grounds of Thornbridge Hall, nr Bakewell, Derbyshire, UK.

Based on innovation, passion and knowledge the brewing team produce high quality beers using the best natural ingredients winning over 100 awards.

name: To Øl
description:
In 2005, sat Tobias Emil Jensen and Tore Gynther at a party at their old high school with their teacher Mikkel Borg Bjergsø and spat into a flat sickly lager. The three talked about that it was too bad that you could not get some decent beer and agreed that the only way to ensure quality was about to brew it yourself. They were allowed to borrow the canteen in the school's closing and began to brew. This meant however that most of the brew was made between the hours of 22 and 6 on weekdays, which resulted in some hard school day for both the two pupils and the teacher, but the beer was appreciated by all the school (near the school cafeteria, which grumbled over filth ).

Later created Mikkel brewery Mikkeller , which has garnered wide international recognition, while Tobias and Tore moved their production into their parents' basement after they were dropped out of high school. Here they continued to hand brew until in 2010 found that two beers were now ripe to make its first commercial brew. Word spread and when it came Mikel for pennies, he insisted on making a collaborative brew between Mikkeller and Two Beers, who became the first beer Two release - Bib IIPA

name: Weston Brewing Company
description: The Weston Brewing Company was first established in 1842 by German immigrant John Georgian. Georgian brought the tradition of lager brewing with him when he settled in Weston. The brewery was designed to utilize ice from the river during winter and lagering cellars dug deep into the ground to create ideal conditions for his beer which needed to be stored below 60 degrees for more than six weeks. In creating the brewery, the Weston Brewing Company became one of the first lager breweries in the United States.

name: Yorkshire Dales Brewing Company
description:
• Brewing a vast selection of contemporary real ales
• Stouts,Smoked Porters, Dunkels, Bocks, Pilsners 3 specials every month
• Bottled conditioned ales, brewed by us, bottled by us
